name: Braeside House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The hosts are so welcoming! The rooms are very clean and well appointed. They are in need of a sitting room for guests though.
reviews.title: Well done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our host set up the outside table with patio heater for an afternoon of conversation and scotch.
reviews.title: A Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful breakfast (with gluten free options in plenty!).
reviews.title: Very nice B&B with view over Loch Linnhe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worth a stay!
reviews.title: A joy to behold a must if traveling in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to book such a lovely accomodation. We received a warm welcome from Paul and Aileen who's friendly manner made our stay very enjoyable. A very clean room and a lovely breakfast to boot. We will return!
reviews.title: More than just a guest house but a home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marie and I took a 3 days week-end at the Braeside House to go skiing and trekking in Glen Nevis valley. Paul & Aileen have a gem of a B&B, brilliant views, excellent breakfast, great room but most of all are very very nice people who will go the extra mile to help out. Thank you for the ride, the chat by the open fire and all the little tips along the way. I know where I will try to stay next time I come for mountain biking or trekking!
reviews.title: Excellent B&B and amazing hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And Sorry it took me so long to put a review :-)
reviews.title: The BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Olivier&Marie
reviews.title: Best B&B in Fort William - Paul and Aileen are the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The BEST B&B I've stayed in. Nothing has competed with the
reviews.title: warm welcome, good value B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: value for money, clean as a whistle place, the view of the lock,
reviews.title: Loved our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This B&B is in One word "Exceptional". but as reviews go, I should of course elaborate.
reviews.title: Fantastic!.... views,comfort,hospitality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: MY wife and I along with our 12 year old daughter stayed here in October, the hosts Paul and Aileen were very friendly and made our stay very enjoyable.There breakfasts served in a room with amazing panoramic views over the Loch were superb, cooked breakfasts (full monty...MMMM), or they offered a variety of other breakfasts.Rooms were comfortable,warm and very clean , our room had the same views as the breakfast room. As it was late October we decided on shorter walks to go on with our daughter. Paul and Aileen were very informative about where to go, they also have a good amount of books and leaflets about the walks and sights to see. This is a spectacular area to visit any time of year but I loved walking in all the autumn colours, and to come back in the evening to a wonderful home like this in which of course the hosts did make it feel like home made this short break one of my most relaxing and memorable ever. Amazing Value for money. Thank you Paul and Aileen, my wife is extremely hard to please and she is already asking when can we book another trip.
reviews.title: Warm welcome and delicious breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The five star rating is very well deserved. We had a very warm welcome from Paul and Aileen and our room was cosy and comfortable with everything you could need - including lovely fluffy bath towels. Everything was spotlessly clean. The view from the breakfast room is stunning - there is even a pair of binoculars on hand to view the loch. Breakfast was delicious - best I have had anywhere for a long time. If I was back in Fort William - I would have no hesitation in returning. Easy 5 minute walk to the end of the High Street and a £5.00 taxi ride back up the hill if you don't fancy the climb!
reviews.title: Best Breakfast on the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From the warm greeting when we arrived, the the big and hearfelt goodbye the next day we felt right at home. Thanks to Paul & Aileen
reviews.title: The View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Positioned up on the hill (but really only a 5 minute walk to the main High-Street), you get the best of both worlds access to the town but a vista across the water. Nice combo.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Paul and Aileen are fab. We arrived after calling them up from reviews on tripadvisor. Paul is such a cheerful man. Welcomed us on arrival. We had room with view over loch in fort William. Room smelt fresh and was warm. Cute ensuite. Paul told us ideas and places to eat dinner. The room presentation was great. TV etc. coffees, teas, biscuits.
reviews.title: Cute, cosy and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: this place is only a five min walk from Main Street so great location to walk to and from dinner. The next day we had a great home cooked breakfast. Aileen cooked it and she is like a mother away from home. Kind caring and wears a NZ apron!!!!!! Instantly she gained points. They were helpful telling us ideas and things to do. They even went extra mile to check that we could go and visit glen Nevis range.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: It was great stay. You have your space but you know that Paul and Aileen are just a call away if you need anything. Value for money!!!! I def recommend:)
reviews.title: Best experience in Fort William!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We would highly recommend this B&B to anyone. A real home from home feel, Aileen & Paul make you feel so welcome. Spent last years Hogmanay and New Year's Day here and it was that amazing we came back this year. Breakfast was absolutely fantastic, rooms are spotless and even though the shower looks small it fits 2 people so can't be that small. No fault whatsoever in Braeside House.
reviews.title: Great setting, very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for best B&B place, great hosts and very testy breakfast - you should defenetly go to this! I stayed in this place for couple a days, and it was my first B&B experience - and I really
reviews.title: Very welcoming!

description: On an elevated position with wonderful views to the Loch and the Ardgour Hills. Away from the noisy busy main road is only a five minute walk to the town centre and the train station. Great location for climbing Ben Nevis and winter skiing with many more attractions within easy reach. Drying room and Laundry provided as well as safe storage for cycles. Home from home relaxing and comfortable atmosphere at a price that suits the purse.
